pullRequest.title: New method for looking for groups by attributes
pullRequest.bodyText:
new method getGroups return list of groups with specific set of
attribtues
can be limited by vo id (it is used as filter now)
we are not supporting core attributes (it is not necessary  to be
able to identify group by description or name using this method)
added test of this funcionality

nodes.bodyText: InternalErrorException is runtime. We are removing all ocurrences in other pull-request.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,27 @@
 	 */
 	List<User> getUsers(PerunSession sess, Map<Attribute, String> attributesWithSearchingValues) throws InternalErrorException;
 
+	/**
+	 * This method get Map of Attributes with searching values and try to find all groups, which have specific attributes in format.
+	 * Better information about format below. When there are more than 1 attribute in Map, it means all must be true "looking for all of them" (AND)
+	 *
+	 * IMPORTANT: can't get CORE ATTRIBUTES
+	 *
+	 * @param sess perun session
+	 * @param attributesWithSearchingValues map of attributes
+	 *        when attribute is type String, so value is string and we are looking for total match (Partial is not supported now, will be supported later by symbol *)
+	 *        when attribute is type Integer, so value is integer in String and we are looking for total match
+	 *        when attribute is type List<String>, so value is String and we are looking for at least one total or partial matching element
+	 *        when attribute is type Map<String> so value is String in format "key=value" and we are looking total match of both or if is it "key" so we are looking for total match of key
+	 *        IMPORTANT: In map there is not allowed char '=' in key. First char '=' is delimiter in MAP item key=value!!!
+	 * @return list of groups who have attributes with specific values (behavior above)
+	 *        if no group exist, return empty list of groups
+	 *        if attributeWithSearchingValues is empty, return all groups
+	 *
+	 * @throws InternalErrorException
+	 */
+	List<Group> getGroups(PerunSession sess, Map<Attribute, String> attributesWithSearchingValues) throws InternalErrorException;

nodes.bodyText: list of users -> list of groups, also for the line below

beforeCommit.message:
New method for looking for groups by attributes

 - new method getGroups return list of groups with specific set of
 attribtues
 - can be limited by vo id (it is used as filter now)
 - we are not supporting core attributes (it is not necessary  to be
 able to identify group by description or name using this method)
 - added test of this funcionality

afterCommit.message:
New method for looking for groups by attributes

 - new method getGroups return list of groups with specific set of
 attribtues
 - can be limited by vo id (it is used as filter now)
 - we are not supporting core attributes (it is not necessary  to be
 able to identify group by description or name using this method)
 - added test of this funcionality

nodes.bodyText: The query method does not throw EmptyResultDataAccessException.

Up to discussion (performance): Both methods getGroups should firstly retrieve all necessary groups. Meaning, that this method retrieves all Vo groups and the second one retrieves all groups. Then they could both use some private method which takes these groups as a parameter alongside the map of attributes. According to these parameters, the private method returns only sufficient groups.
You can return the result of the method right away.
Unnecessary continue statement. You can negate the if statement so you do not have to use else branch.
I prefer isEmpty() rather than equals(""). It is more readable and I've read that isEmpty() is a little bit quicker than the other approach.

commit.message:
New method for looking for groups by attributes

 - new method getGroups return list of groups with specific set of
 attribtues
 - can be limited by vo id (it is used as filter now)
 - we are not supporting core attributes (it is not necessary  to be
 able to identify group by description or name using this method)
 - added test of this funcionality
